When a player captures a Vital Element they may make a special bonus move, such as teleporting a piece across the board or resurrecting a captured Warrior, according to what shape of Element was captured. If a player captures all four opposing Vital Elements they win the game.

Name: Frog Pig Pug
Description:
FAST-playing, Quick-thinking, PUG-yelling FUN!

Frog Pig Pug is a quick, simple to learn, yet challenging puzzle game. Frog Pig Pug is suitable for players as young as six. Borrowing mechanics from the classic card game Set, the game has been updated with fun animal art, new game play, and new rules - it takes 10-15 minutes to play and each game is totally different.

The goal of Frog Pig Pug is to identify a Proper Unit Group or 'PUG'. Each PUG consists of three cards that are all the same OR all different in their individual traits. There are three traits on every card of Frog Pig Pug: type of animal, color of animal, and number of animals. Six cards are dealt on the table face-up from the deck into the community pool, and each player is dealt one card that only they can utilize. Once a PUG is identified, a player yells "PUG" and gathers the cards in the PUG once confirmed by the other players.

Any used community pool cards or cards from the player's hand are replaced and play continues until all the cards from the deck are spent.  The player with the most PUGs wins!

Name: Viticulture: Visit from the Rhine Valley
Description:
You have new visitors! Visit from the Rhine Valley, an expansion for Viticulture, provides you with a new set of eighty visitor cards, which focus less on victory points and more on the wine business itself. These cards have their own unique backs as they must be played without other visitor cards from Viticulture, Tuscany, and Moor Visitors.

—description from the publisher

Name: Atride
Description:
Atride is a three-player abstract strategy game with a rock-paper-scissors mechanic between the three players: the foxes can kill the chickens, but the chickens can kill the snakes which can kill the foxes.

Each player starts with five of their animal ranged along one side of a 7x7 triangular board. On their turn they advance one of their animals one step in one of two forward directions. They can capture a prey animal by putting two of their animals in a line with it (custodian capture) or in a small triangle with it. A captured animal is replaced with an additional animal of the team that captured it.

The winner is the first player to get one of their animals to the opposite corner of the triangle.

—user summary

Name: Pélaghos
Description:
&#039;&#039;&#039;&#039;&#039;Pélaghos&#039;&#039;&#039;&#039;&#039; is a world of ships and full of magic, a world with large oceans filled with unexplored or barely known islands...
The most powerful and influential human nations dominate most of the world, but it’s also home to exotic creatures such as Elves, Minotaurs and Fairies. It’s also a world of dangers. Deep within the ocean, or in lairs on unexplored islands, mystic and monstrous creatures wait for those daring to explore these mysterious places. Hidden magic artifacts and valuable treasures are the reward for those brave enough to face the hostile situations that few dares to challenge. It’s a large world, full of conflicts between nations, so expect diplomacy, betrayal and battles.

&#039;&#039;Pélaghos&#039;&#039; is a modular Boardgame with a ton of cards. Players choose between one of the four nations to reach supremacy through victory points, achieved by different strategies such as: Exploring, Completing nation objectives, Combat, Deliveries and Adventures.
One of Pélaghos main game mechanics is Hand Management: Knowing which card to discard and knowing what to buy is key to success. There is also a strong Set Collection mechanic, where you build your composition in the best way possible to achieve your goals, involving your ships, captain and crew.
It also has pick-up and deliver mechanics in the game, where you take a delivery in your port and have to take it to a specific place, and finally Dice Roll, which is optional to do when exploring. In Pélaghos, Combat is designed in two different ways: Naval Artillery and Boarding, both with their distinct mechanics. That being said, all of your card choices may affect the results of different paths chosen in the game, mitigating how Luck affects your game.

&#039;&#039;—description from the publisher (translated)&#039;&#039;

Pélaghos é um mundo de navios e magia, um mundo com grandes oceanos cheios de ilhas inexploradas ou pouco conhecidas.
As nações humanas mais poderosas e influentes dominam a maior parte do mundo, mas ele também é lar para criaturas exóticas como Elfos, Minotauros e Fadas. É também um mundo de perigos. Criaturas monstruosas e místicas esperam no fundo do oceano, ou em covis em ilhas inexploradas, por aqueles que ousarem explorar esses lugares misteriosos. Artefatos mágicos escondidos e tesouros valiosos são a recompensa para aqueles corajosos o suficiente para encarar situações hostis que poucos ousam desafiar. É um mundo grande, cheio de conflito entre as nações, então espere diplomacia, traição e batalhas.
Pélaghos é um boardgame com tabuleiro modular e muitas cartas, jogadores escolhem uma das 04 nações e assume seus avatares para correr atrás da supremacia do mundo de Pélaghos através de pontos de vitórias, tendo diversas formas de ganhá-los a depender da estratégia utilizada: fazendo aventuras, fazendo fretes, explorando, cumprindo objetivos ou fazendo combates. Também há como se organizar e tentar fazer tudo ao mesmo tempo. Uma das principais mecânicas é gerenciamento de mão: saber o que descartar e saber o que comprar pode ser a chave do sucesso. Terá que fazer também uma combinação de cartas (set collection), onde você monta a melhor composição para o que você quer fazer, envolvendo a classe do seu navio, escolha do capitão e tripulação. Ainda presentes as mecânicas de pick-up and deliver ao realizar fretagem do seu porto para um local do tabuleiro e rolagem de dados, que é opcional ao realizar explorações. Como um jogo marítimo não podíamos deixar de lados os combates de abordagem com duelos com disputas de forças e equipamentos e combate de artilharia com rolagem de dados para acertos e erros com seus canhões em navios além de contar com cartas táticas dos recursos gerais para mitigar a sorte no jogo.

&#039;&#039;—description from the publisher&#039;&#039;

Name: Sustainable development geek
Description:
Sustainable development geek is a trivia/debate game based on questions about the United Nations sustainable development goals (SDGs). Question cards are associated with one of the 17 SDGs and provide 2 possible answers (A/B). The correct answer is listed on the back of the card with an explanation.

Two game modes are available:

     Achieve them all (2-4 players)
     The great debate (5-10 players)


Two additional "animation" modes are described:

     General assembly (10-70 people)
     Facilitation (any group events)


In the "achieve them all" game mode, each player takes a turn answering as many questions about SDGs as they want. They receive each card they answered correctly, but the card is only saved once the player decides to stop. Whenever a player gives a wrong answer, all is/her unsaved cards are discarded and his/her turn ends. The next player then takes his/her turn. The first player to collect cards for all 17 SDGs wins the game.

In the "great debate" game mode, 2 players (debaters A and B) are picked to argue for 30 seconds in favour of answer A or B. Other players (deciders) then vote on which answer is correct. The debater who got the most votes keeps the card (counts as 1 point). Deciders who found the right answer score 1 point. The game ends after a set number of turns.

—user summary

Name: The Saxon Shore Is Burning (Second Edition)
Description:
This is the Second Edition of the game that was originally published in 2002. The physical components of the game are a vast improvement on the first edition with a full colour map that is twice the size of the original monochrome map, more than 400 full colour illustrated and mounted counters, rather than the 200 in the original game and a fully revised and corrected rule book that has introduced some subtle but important changes to game play. For example over-stacked units now desert instead of being eliminated.

—description from the publisher

Click on the official link below and the game can be obtained from the publisher for the princely sum of £15 or £12 for a Society of Ancients member.

Name: Caverna: The Forgotten Folk – Halflings promo
Description: Promo for the Caverna expansion The Forgotten Folk. Instead of dwarfs as usual, a player can now also colonize the mountain as a Halfling.

Name: Forged Realms: Shadow Woods
Description:
An expansion to the Forged Realms game.

Add all new cards to the Forged Realms Core Set with the 2nd add-on pack containing 16 non-random cards including Crow Knight, Dire Wolf, Nightmare and powerful spells such as the Pyroblast and Goblin Elixur.
—description from the back of the box

Name: 5150: Hammer & Anvil
Description:
From the introduction:

"5150 Hammer & Anvil is the companion book to 5150 Star Army – 2nd Tour, and can also be used with 5150 Star Marines.

Hammer & Anvil is a set of Sci-Fi tank combat rules that focuses not only on the vehicle, but its individual crew members. Hammer & Anvil can be played with any counters, models, or minis you may already have. Play it as a RPG or as a wargame; it’s both."

From the rules:

"In Hammer & Anvil each vehicle consists of both the vehicle and its crew. Players will usually start with one or two vehicles and work their way up to larger numbers. No matter what size formation you decide to use, the basic starting point is the individual vehicle and its crew."

Name: Fallen Land: Exiles & Caravans
Description: As the 5th installment for Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game, Exiles and Caravans will add Cooperative game play, more cards, optional and advanced rules, Solo Variant IV and campaign variant III and IV to the massive world gone mad.  Come immerse yourselves!  A massive wasteland world awaits!

Name: Up the Boot: Italy 1943-1945
Description:
“This campaign is a hard row to hoe. It is the most difficult country in Europe, and yet we always get troops and equipment taken away from us for elsewhere. We have done all the fighting on a very narrow margin of relative strengths.” - Oliver Leese, Commander 8th Army

Up the Boot is an operational simulation of the Italian campaign from the invasion of Sicily to the collapse of German and Fascist Italian forces in 1945. The game uses hexes and division scale units, supported by assets including naval, air, and small elite forces.

One can play the entire campaign or a scenario.

Scenarios include...

The Invasion of Sicily: Kicking in the Door
The Invasion of Italy: The Allied Avalanche
The Volturno Line: The Long Slog Up the Boot
Anzio and Cassino: Breaking the Gustav Line
The Gothic Line: Bloody Stalemate
The Po Valley: Blitzkrieg Comes to Italy

“No amount of artillery fire or aerial bombardment could force them to withdraw. That was for the infantry to do employing those weapons that find and destroy life in narrow trenches, caves, and fighting holes. It was up to the man with the rifle. The man under fire from all weapons. Them whose way all our weapons land, air, and sea serve only to prepare. It was up to the foot soldier to attack a hidden enemy over ground that was sown with mines. The anti-personnel mines that fly up the footfall to explode beneath the groin.” – John Huston, The Battle of San Pietro (1944)

—description from the publisher

Name: PORN: The Game! – The Extreme Drunkard Expansion
Description:
Pulling inspiration from classic drinking games, and made for those who demanded “more drinking cards!”, this addition to PORN: THE GAME! is a must-have for spicing up your Parties and Gameplay.

With this add-on, Porn: The Game goes from Skinamax to Extreme Hardcore through 18 unique cards with mini-games and uproarious challenges.

You've got:
Scissoring ...(bumping tacos)
Cam-Girls ...(face to face)
VHS ...(Missionary Impossible)
and many more.

This Expansion tips the scale of the original game, taking it from casual fun to a twisted orgy of booze and gut-wrenching laughter, with unique, and original, digital art, humorous taglines, and new Gameplay.

If PORN: THE GAME is Foreplay,
this is the Orgasm.

ENLARGE YOUR DECK TODAY.

—description from the designer

Name: PORN: The Game! – CENSORED
Description:
Porn: The Game!  (CENSORED)
COCK-BLOCKED EDITION
This edition of Porn: The Game! gives you all the cards without ANY of the balls.

INCLUDES: The Original Deck & Extreme Drunkard Expansion with Fully Censored-Art

...censorship comes at a price
Nobody likes a Cock-Block

-description from the designer

Name: Magical Musical Chairs: The Card Game
Description:
The entire deck is dealt out and one person is left holding the chair. A 10 point card that can only be played if it's the last card in your hand. Players take turns rolling the die, which has 4 colored music notes on it and 2 black notes. When rolled you may play a music card of the specific color from your hand and then take the action written on the card. Some cards allow you to steal a card or give a card away or make everyone shuffle their cards around the circle. In the 21+ version of the game each card also has a drink ability which may allow you to give a drink or even make everyone take a drink. Designed to be played with many people this game can take up to 10 players and is a quick fast paced party game. The game continues and players hand sizes decrease the elusive chair becomes easier to spot but only one person will end the game with it. The question remains will it be played for points or will it be stuck in someones hand for negative points?

—description from the publisher

Name: Matapan:  The Naval Battle for Greece, Mar41
Description:
The 27-28 March 1941 Allied and Italian naval operations at 40mis/64kms per hex in 3-hour turns.  Ultra (if it works) and the possibility of false Luftwaffe reports of reduced British battleship strength being true put opposing commanders in an historical fog of war decision-making environment.  Dummy units included to enhance that.

The 7 Greek destroyers who tried to make it into action (via the Canal of Corinth) have the chance to succeed as well.  Older, somewhat slower Italian battleships Caio Duilio and Giulio Cesare may be used/risked by Italian player.

Naval combat simplified as in my other naval battle and campaign games, or the players can choose to resolve that instead using my (also free print-and-play) Naval Action (or any other) naval miniatures rules with the game's pixel-by-pixel crafted individual ship pieces.

Naval forces can be divided among multiple strategic and operational/tactical commanders, as in my Leyte Gulf Naval Chess Game.

—description from the designer

Name: Carcassonne: The Fruit-Bearing Trees
Description:
A mini expansion for the game Carcassonne and part of the Carcassonne series.

With this expansion, Carcassonne will be surrounded by various fruit-bearing trees.
The larger the variety of fruits you offer is, the higher your income will be.

This mini-expansion contains 6 new land tiles with 6 types of
fruit-bearing trees (quince, apple,apricot, cherry, plum and elder & 24 fruit tokens (4 per fruit with the value 5, 4, 3, 2 on the back).
